Model equations¶

The model equations are presented here. Each model setup represents specific a combination of equations. We refer to Constant model parameters and Model variables representing the described parameters and variables as objects (e.g. float, array).

Time-stepping¶

Three different time-stepping schemes are available to solve the equations. The time-stepping depends on the model setup:

  • adaptive time-stepping is used for long-term hydrologic modelling (i.e. modelling the water balance over multiple years)

  • fixed time-stepping is used for short-term hydrologic modelling (i.e. modelling a single rainfall event)

  • fixed time-stepping with internal substepping is used for solute transport models
